results.title: I was there
results.creator_credit: Kristian Ryhammer, Teamfilm AS and Central Film O
results.brief_description: A survey of the modern integrated transport system in Norway - a rail ticket entitles you to travel by train, boat or bus and you may break your journey when and where you like. Shows the modern cities, historic buildings, old fishing villages and the spectacular scenery. (Awards: Lisboa)

results.title: I Was a Teenage Werewolf
results.creator_credit: Sunset Productions, American International Pictures, Gene Fowler Jr., A. Leslie Thomas, Herman Cohen and Aben Kandel
results.brief_description: A meat-eating teenager (Michael Landon) sees a psychiatrist (Whit Bissell), who only makes things worse.

constellations_other.name: Horror movie right there on my TV
constellations_other.description: The colourful and quirky music video for Skyhooks’ song 'Horror Movie' helped propel them to number one, making it their biggest hit.

results.title: I was a teenage werewolf
results.creator_credit: Gene Fowler Jr, Herman Cohen, American International Pictures (AIP) and Sunset Productions
results.brief_description: Tony Rivers (Michael Landon) is an angry, troubled teen who shows misguided aggression towards his friends and family. Sensing something is awry, Tony agrees to see psychologist Dr Brandon, a skilled hypnotist. Unbeknownst to Tony however, Brandon is hell-bent on seeing Tony regress to a primal state under his influence. When a teen is killed, seemingly by an animal, the facts are soon uncovered - Tony is a werewolf. Despite its B-movie origins and stock characterisations, “I was a teenage werewolf” plays as a sharp analogy for the trials, physical transformations, alienation and inherent difficulties of puberty.

results.title: I was a teenage frankenstein
results.creator_credit: Herbert L. Strock, Herman Cohen and American International Pictures (AIP)
results.brief_description: In this reinterpretation of the Frankenstein myth, Whit Bissell plays Professor Frankenstein - a scientist obsessed by theories of transplanting organs, recreating humans out of discarded parts. A firm believer in experimental medicine Frankenstein plans to create a man, made up of parts from various cadavers. Despite the misgivings of his colleagues, Frankenstein perseveres with this plan, even when it entails killing off his curious fiancee. Conveniently, when a car crashes nearby and several teenagers die, Frankenstein eagerly steals a body thrown clear. From these methods then Professor Frankenstein assembles his creation - who turns out to be a monstrous variation of a man, with a perfect body but a mangled face and deranged mind. Feared and loathed, the monster starts to kill and maraud the innocent, until he turns on his creator. Notwithstanding the low production values and ham acting, this curious film holds a certain appeal as a display of 50s attitudes and paranoia, mixed with B-grade horror movie tropes. Cast includes: Phyllis Coates, Gary Conway, Robert Burton and George Lynn.

results.title: I was a ninety pound weakling. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Wolf Koenig, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A round-up of what goes on in the toe-touching parlors of a large city. Here you see modern man brought to bay by his own poundage, resolved to erase by exercise what rich food, idleness and age have put on. In yoga headstand schools and flesh-shrinking lofts, high resolves to beat the bulge reach strange and sometimes amusing ends. (A revised version of the original film of the same title.)

results.title: I was a ninety pound weakling
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Wolf Koenig, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An amusing character study of people who are anxious to keep themselves fit and to also keep other people in good condition. Sports coaches, gymnasium proprietors, exercise machine salesmen, a health book publisher and a yoga instructor are interviewed. They discuss the frequent low standards of physical fitness in Canada and the various ways they recommend for improving physical condition.

results.title: I Was a male war bride
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Sol Siegal and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Classic Howard Hawks’ comedy sees Cary Grant play Captain Henri Rochard, a French officer who falls for an American army official staioned in Europe. Following the chaos however, and bureaucratic red-tape that marked the cessations of hostilities in World War 2, the pair find it almost impossible to make their union legal. Circumstances force Rochard to pose an a ‘war bride’ in order to secure happiness, which of course leads to no end of strife and embarrassment for the eager groom.

results.title: I want to work
results.creator_credit: D Lynton Porter, Vroni Gordon and Central Council for Health Education
results.brief_description: Deals with the problems faced by epileptics seeking employment. Traces the career of a teenage girl on the point of leaving school who finds she is not wanted in any position because she is an epileptic. Finally she joins the British Epileptic Association which helps her to find employment and provides fellowship by the sharing of a common problem.

results.title: I Want to live!
results.creator_credit: Robert Wise, Walter Wanger, Figaro Films and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning performance by actress Susan Hayward in the lead role of Barbara Graham. Based on actual events and letters from Barbara at the time, comes the story of a girl who had spent time in reform school due to a hard youth when becoming a woman moves easily into the seedy underworld of drugs, parties and prostitution. Barbara attempts to go straight but falls back into her old ways when her junkie husband can no longer support her or her baby son. When two acquaintances are charged with murder they blame Barbara but she continues to protest her innocence. Vilified by the press and subject to an all male jury, Barbara Graham is tried and sentenced. The death penalty by gas chamber is her fate and very believably the way her character is transformed from good-time girl to suffering victim is testimony to the strength of Hayward’s performance. Shot in black and white with a driving jazz soundtrack (even an appearance by Gerry Mulligan) with tight direction by Robert Wise providing an overall intense dramatic experience.

results.title: I want to go to school
results.creator_credit: John Krish, Karel Reisz, Leon Clore, National Union of Teachers and Graphic Films
results.brief_description: An impression of a day at an average primary school. The main theme is the relationship which develops between child and teacher during early education. Sequences of classroom and individual instruction, improvised play acting, indoor and outdoor recreation, illustrate the well balanced curriculum provided. Intended to help parents towards an understanding of their children’s school activities.
